com.inrix.sdk

Class AlertsManager.RouteIncidentAlertOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.inrix.sdk.AlertsManager.RouteIncidentAlertOptions
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlertsManager.IncidentAlertOptions
    Enclosing class:
    AlertsManager

    public static class AlertsManager.RouteIncidentAlertOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains options that specify how to create an incident alert.
    See Also:
    AlertsManager.createIncidentAlert(com.inrix.sdk.AlertsManager.IncidentAlertOptions, com.inrix.sdk.AlertsManager.IIncidentsAlertListener)

    • Method Detail

      • setSpeedFactor

        public AlertsManager.RouteIncidentAlertOptions setSpeedFactor(float value)
        Sets the speed factor. This value is used to dynamically determine incident distance depending on current speed. For instance, if the speed factor is set to 10 and the current speed is 60mph, the alert manager will request incidents in a 6 miles radius (60mph / 10 = 6). A higher speed will result in a bigger radius in which to request incidents.
        Parameters:
        value - The speed factor, which should be positive number. Default value is DEFAULT_SPEED_FACTOR.
        Returns:
        This instance of the AlertsManager.RouteIncidentAlertOptions class.
        Throws:
        AlertsManager.AlertsManagerException - Thrown when the speed factor is invalid.

        public AlertsManager.RouteIncidentAlertOptions setInterval(long value)

        The interval must be positive number.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        This instance of the AlertsManager.IncidentAlertOptions class.
        Throws:
